page.title: 06AGRICULTURE - ANIMALS
page.content:
SHEEP- Three farmers have breeding flocks of Cross Greyfaced Ewes. Hill ewe lambs are wintered by some farmers and returned to the hill farms for the rest of their lives.
COWS- There are only two farms in this area which have 'house' cows i.e. milk produced is for farmhouse use only. Surplus is fed to calves.
CATTLE- Farmers have mainly 'bought- in' calves which are kept until 18 months old then sold as store cattle to other farmers for fattening up.
POULTRY- Hens are kept at a few farms. The eggs are for home consumption only.
